instruction: Summarize the following article about the effects of smoking.
input: Smoking dramatically increases your risk of both cancer and heart disease. The toxic chemicals in cigarettes damage your lungs and can reduce your ability to exercise. Plus, smoking is linked to higher cholesterol levels and stiffened arteries, making a heart attack or stroke more likely. Finally, smoking will damage your appearance, making your skin look older and your teeth yellow.
output: Smoking has been linked to a significantly increased risk in cancer and heart disease. Chemicals in cigarettes can damage the lungs and cholesterol levels, making the user more vulnerable to a stroke or heart attack, while also having a negative effect on physical appearance.
